main event: An AF pilot observed a very bright disc-shaped object traveling in the same direction and at the same speed as his aircraft in Clay Center, Kansas on July 6, 1947.
interesting points: The object was reported to be 30' to 50' in diameter and flying at an altitude of 11,000 feet., The speed of the object was estimated at 210 mph., The object appeared at the 11 o'clock position relative to the sun., The witness expressed some inconsistency regarding the object's altitude claiming initially it was low., There was speculation that the bright object could have been a reflection from the sun on clouds or ice crystals.
